titles.title: REEF Act
Railroad Employee Equity and Fairness Act
REEF Act
Railroad Employee Equity and Fairness Act
REEF Act
A bill to permanently exempt payments made from the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Account from sequestration under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Budget.
Committee on the Budget. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on the Budget. Reported by Senator Whitehouse without amendment. Without written report.

committee.name: Senate Budget
committee.activity: Reported By, Reported By, Markup By, Referred To

term.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

bill.summary:
Railroad Employee Equity and Fairness Act or the REEF Act
This bill permanently exempts payments made from the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Account from sequestration. Sequestration is a process of automatic, usually across-the-board spending reductions under which budgetary resources are permanently cancelled to enforce specific budget policy goals.
Currently, this exemption ends 30 days after the termination of the COVID-19 national emergency period.
